noun.description: A member of either of two culturally similar but geographically separate and linguistically distinct North American peoples, the Southern Paiute of the southwestern US and the Northern Paiute of Oregon and Nevada.
Either of the Uto-Aztecan languages of the Paiute.

adjective.description: Relating to the Paiute or their languages.

origin: From Spanish Payuchi, Payuta, influenced by Ute.
